Name: Rami 'Omar 'Ali Zahran
Notes: Shot in the head by members of the Palestinian Authority security forces during their arrest raid in the camp. According to the Palestinian Authority, their security forces returned fire. Zahran was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Feisal Khalil Ibrahim Saba'anah
Notes: Killed in a fire exchange between members of the Palestinian Authority security forces and armed Palestinians, while driving his car in the city’s eastern neighborhood. The Palestinian Authority claims Saba’anah was shot by armed men, while the Committee of Families of Prisoners and Martyrs in the city claimed he was shot by Palestinian Authority personnel. B'Tselem has no further information about the circumstances of his death.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Ya'qub Ahmad Abu Muna
Notes: Killed in a fire exchange with members of the Palestinian Authority security forces. The Palestinian Authority claimed Abu Muna opened fire on the forces operating at the scene. Abu Muna was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Qasam Mahmoud Hussein al-Haj
Notes: Wounded by Palestinian Authority security forces’ gunfire together with his father and sister, a minor, on the roof of their home in the eastern part of the camp. Taken to Ibn Sina Hospital in the city of Jenin, where he was pronounced dead. His father also died of his wounds.

Name: Mahmoud Hussein Qassem al-Haj
Notes: Wounded by Palestinian Authority security forces’ gunfire together with his son and daughter, both minors, on the roof of their home in the eastern part of the camp. Taken to the governmental Hospital in the city of Jenin, where he was pronounced dead. His son also died of his wounds.

Name: Hussein Ahmad Hassan Nassar
Notes: An officer in the Palestinian Preventive Security. Killed by armed Palestinians during during Operation Homeland Defense launched by the Palestinian Authority more than three weeks earlier. That day, a Palestinian woman was killed in the camp.

Name: Shatha Naser Mahmoud Sabagh
Notes: Shot in her doorway while stepping out with her two nephews, minors, to go to a nearby convenience store. According to the family, Sabagh was shot by a Palestinian Authority security forces sniper stationed on a nearby rooftop. The Palestinian Authority claims she was shot by an armed Palestinian. The incident took place during Operation Homeland Defense launched by the Palestinian Authority more than three weeks earlier. B'Tselem was unable to determine the source of the lethal gunfire. That day, a Palestinian Preventive Security officer was killed by armed Palestinians in the camp.

Name: Ibrahim Jamal Saleh Jum'ah
Notes: An officer in the Palestinian Preventive Security. Killed by armed Palestinians, who fired at the house he was in with other officers and hurled Molotov cocktails at it, setting it on fire, during during Operation Homeland Defense launched by the Palestinian Authority more than three weeks earlier.

Name: Ahmad Ma'sud Khalil Abu Libdah
Notes: Shot and injured by Palestinian Preventive Security members while walking along the street with his wife by their home. At the time, clashes were taking place in several places in the camp, including exchanges of fire between Preventive Security members and armed Palestinians, during during Operation Homeland Defense launched by the Palestinian Authority more than three weeks earlier. Died of his wounds a short while later.

Name: Majd Amjad 'Ata Zidan
Notes: נפצע מירי אנשי מנגנוני הביטחון של הרשות הפלסטינית במהלך מבצע "הגנת המולדת" שבו פתחה הרשות במחנה כשלושה שבועות קודם לכן, כשהיה בסמוך למסגד אל-אנסאר בשכונת א-דמג' שם התנהלו עימותים שכללו חילופי אש בין אנשי המנגנונים לבין חמושים פלסטינים. פונה באמבולנס לבית חולים אבן סינא בעיר ג'נין ושם נקבע מותו.

Name: Mahran Murad Musa Qadus
Notes: שוטר במנגנוני הביטחון של הרשות הפלסטינית. נהרג במהלך חילופי אש עם חמושים פלסטינים במהלך מבצע "הגנת המולדת" שבו פתחה הרשות כשלושה שבועות קודם לכן. באותו יום הרגו אנשי המנגנונים קטין פלסטיני במחנה.

Name: Saher Faruq Jum'ah Irhil
Notes: קצין במשמר הנשיא במנגנוני הביטחון של הרשות הפלסטינית. נהרג במהלך חילופי אש עם חמושים פלסטינים במהלך מבצע "הגנת המולדת" שבו פתחה הרשות כשבועיים קודם לכן. איש מנגנונים נוסף נפצע במהלך חילופי אש עם חמושים באותו יום במחנה ומת מפצעיו כשלושה ימים לאחר מכן.

Name: Hassan Nader Bani 'Odeh
Notes: קצין במשמר הנשיא במנגנוני הביטחון של הרשות הפלסטינית. נפצע במהלך חילופי אש עם חמושים פלסטינים במהלך מבצע "הגנת המולדת" שבו פתחה הרשות כשבועיים קודם לכן. איש מנגנונים נוסף נהרג במחנה במהלך חילופי אש עם חמושים באותו יום.

Name: Yazid Muhammad Nayef Ja'aysah
Notes: נורה למוות במהלך חילופי אש עם אנשי מנגנוני הביטחון של הרשות הפלסטינית במהלך מבצע "הגנת המולדת" שבו פתחה הרשות במחנה כתשעה ימים קודם לכן. באותו יום הרגו אנשי המנגנונים קטין פלסטיני שעמד בפתח ביתו במחנה. ג'עאייסה היה בכיר בזרוע הצבאית של הג'יהאד האסלאמי.

Name: Muhammad 'Imad Ibrahim 'Amer
Notes: נפצע מירי אנשי מנגנוני הביטחון של הרשות הפלסטינית בפתח ביתו במהלך מבצע "הגנת המולדת" שבו פתחה הרשות במחנה כתשעה ימים קודם לכן. עאמר פונה באמבולנס לבית חולים אבן סינא בעיר ג'נין וממנו לבית חולים בעיר שכם, שם מת מפצעיו זמן קצר לאחר מכן. באותו יום הרגו אנשי המנגנונים במחנה פלסטיני נוסף במהלך חילופי אש.

Name: Ribhi Muhammad Ribhi Shalabi
Notes: נורה בידי אנשי מנגנוני הביטחון של הרשות הפלסטינית במהלך מבצע "הגנת המולדת" שבו פתחה הרשות כארבעה ימים קודם לכן. שלבי נסע על קטנוע יחד עם בן דודו הקטין, שנפצע מהירי, והיה בדרכו ללקוח במסגרת עבודתו כשליח. בתיעוד ממצלמת אבטחה נראה הקטנוע כשהוא עוצר בקרבת ג'יפ של המנגנונים, ואז מרים שלבי ידיים ומייד לאחר-מכן נפתחת עליהם אש.

Name: Wafaa Nayef Zuhdi Jarar
Notes: Severely injured while transported to detention by soldiers and Border Police officers who had entered her home during a raid of the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. by military, Border Police and Shin Bet forces. The military vehicle she was in drove over an explosive device and she was injured in the explosion. Jarar was taken to a hospital in Israel, where both her legs were amputated. From there, she was transferred to Ibn Sina Hospital in Jenin, after the administrative detention order issued against her was revoked about nine days after her arrest. She later died of her injuries at the hospital. During Israeli forces’ raid on the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C., which lasted about two days, Israeli forces killed 12 Palestinians and wounded at least 15.

Name: Ahmad Hisham Salim al-Ful
Notes: Wounded by shots fired by members of the Palestinian Authority security forces while driving his car in the city, after, according to the forces, opening fire on them. Died of his wounds shortly after. Al-Foul was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Muhammad 'Ursan Yusef Salamah
Notes: Wounded by shots fired by members of the Palestinian Authority security forces when families of prisoners and deceased persons crowded near the forces’ headquarters in the city, threw explosive devices at it and fired at it.

Name: 'Ammar Mustafa 'Abd al-Fatah Mansur
Notes: Fatally shot by Palestinians while riding in his car on Route 60, near the intersection with Route 465. A Palestinian citizen of Israel who was riding in the car behind him was also injured by the gunfire and died of her wounds on 25 January 2024.

Name: Ahmad Hashem 'Abd a-Rahim 'Obeidi
Notes: Shot in the head by members of the Palestinian Authority security forces at the end of a chase, while driving his car in the camp. ‘Obeidi was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: 'Azzam Jamal Hamad Jawabreh
Notes: Fatally shot by armed Palestinians along with another Palestinian man, on suspicion of collaborating with Israel.

Name: Hamzah Ahmad Hamzah Mubarak
Notes: Fatally shot by armed Palestinians along with another Palestinian man, on suspicion of collaborating with Israel.

Name: 'Ali Hassan Muhammad Faraj
Notes: Accidentally shot in the neck by armed Palestinians while outside the central Fatah headquarters in the camp. In the bombing of the headquarters later that day, four more Palestinians were killed, including a minor and three other al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives, one of them a senior operative. Clashes broke out following the Israeli forces’ incursion, during which Palestinians fired at them.

Name: 'Abd al-Karim Ibrahim Mahmoud Qarariyah
Notes: Member of the Palestinian Authority security forces. Wounded in the head by shots fired by armed Palestinians during an arrest operation in the camp.

Name: Mahmoud Raafat Mahmoud Abu Laban
Notes: Run over by a Palestinian Authority security forces’ jeep during a demonstration against the war in Gaza in the city.

Name: Muhammad Mar'i Ahmad Sawaftah
Notes: Shot by members of the Palestinian Authority Security Services during a demonstration against the war in Gaza in which protestors threw stones at the local police station.

Name: Razan 'Utbah Hamidi Nasrallah
Notes: A passerby shot in the chest by members of the Palestinian Security Services who were clashing with protestors following a demonstration against the war in Gaza. Their gunfire injured another Palestinian, who succumbed to his wounds on 21 October 2023.

Name: Firas Hatem Hussein Bizari
Notes: Wounded in the head by members of the Palestinian Security Services who were clashing with protestors following a demonstration against the war in Gaza. Their gunfire also killed a Palestinian minor who was passing by.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad Ghanami a-Shibaki
Notes: Killed in his home by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians. His wife was wounded.

Name: Layan Bilal Muhammad Mdoukh
Notes: Killed while playing on the street by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians in a nearby house. Another minor living in the home that was struck was also killed and 10 other people were wounded.

Name: Yazan Jawdat Fathi 'Alian
Notes: Killed in his home by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians. Another minor was killed while playing on the street and 10 other people were wounded.

Name: Zuheir Khalil Zuheir Ghaliz
Notes: Fatally shot by Lion's Den operatives after being suspected of collaborating with Israel.

Name: Bahaa Muhammad Ahmad Abu al-Heija
Notes: Wounded by stray bullets fired by armed Palestinians during an incursion into the camp by Israeli forces.

Name: Firas Fares Fayez Yaish
Notes: Passerby killed during an exchange of fire between armed Palestinians and Palestinian Authority security service agents, while the security service was carrying out an arrest in the city.

Name: Samer Mahmoud Suliman Khaled
Notes: Fatally shot by armed Palestinians after not heeding their demand to stop at the entrance to the refugee camp, during a military incursion into the camp.

Name: Yasser Nimer Mahmoud a-Nabahin
Notes: Killed at home by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians, along with his daughter and two of his sons, all minors. Another of his sons was wounded in the incident.

Name: Muhammad Yasser Nimer a-Nabahin
Notes: Killed at home by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians, along with his father and his brother and sister, both minors. Another brother was wounded in the attack.

Name: Dalia Yasser Nimer a-Nabahin
Notes: Killed at home by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians, along with her father and two of her brothers, who were minors. Another brother was wounded in the attack.

Name: Ahmad Yasser Nimer a-Nabahin
Notes: Killed at home by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians, along with his father and his brother and sister, both minors. Another brother was wounded in the attack.

Name: Diyaa Zuheir Ahmad al-Bura'i
Notes: Killed at his vegetable stand by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians that hit a house nearby. Six other people were wounded in the incident. Another Palestinian was killed when a wall collapsed while he was evacuating wounded people from the house.

Name: Fatimah 'Ayed 'Abd al-Fatah A'beid
Notes: Killed at home by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians that hit the front entrance. Six other people were wounded in the incident, including two minors.

Name: Na'amah Tulbah Hammad Abu Qaydah
Notes: Killed by a mortar shell fired by armed Palestinians while standing outside a house where a family event was taking place. Seven more family members, including four minors, one of whom was her granddaughter, were wounded in the attack. The granddaughter died of her wounds on 8 August 2022.

Name: Hanin Walid Muhammad Abu Qaydah
Notes: Killed by a mortar shell fired by armed Palestinians while standing outside a house where a family event was taking place. Her grandmother was killed in the attack and six other family members, including three minors, were wounded.

Name: Nafez Muhammad Musbah Jum'ah al-Khatib
Notes: Killed by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians along with six other Palestinians, including four minors, near ‘Imad ‘Aqel Mosque. 48 more people were wounded, including 27 minors.

Name: Ahmad Walid Ahmad al-Farram
Notes: Killed by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians along with six other Palestinians, including three minors, near ‘Imad ‘Aqel Mosque. 48 more people were wounded, including 27 minors.

Name: Khalil Iyad Mustafa Abu Hamadah
Notes: Killed by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians along with six other Palestinians, including four minors, near ‘Imad ‘Aqel Mosque. 48 more people were wounded, including 27 minors.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad Ahmad a-Nayrab
Notes: Killed by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians along with his brother, who was a minor, and five other Palestinians, two of them minors, near ‘Imad ‘Aqel Mosque. 48 more people were wounded, including 27 minors.

Name: Muamen Muhammad Ahmad a-Nayrab
Notes: Killed by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians along with his brother, who was a minor, and five other Palestinians, two of them minors, near ‘Imad ‘Aqel Mosque. 48 more people were wounded, including 27 minors.

Name: Hazem Muhammad 'Ali Salem
Notes: Killed by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians along with six other Palestinians, including three minors, near ‘Imad ‘Aqel Mosque. 48 more people were wounded, including 27 minors.

Name: Muhammad Muhammad Ibrahim Zaqut
Notes: Killed by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians along with six other Palestinians, including four minors, near ‘Imad ‘Aqel Mosque. 48 more people were wounded, including 27 minors.

Name: Hassan Muhammad Hassan Abu Zayed
Notes: Shot in the groin by Hamas military wing field monitoring personnel after, according to the Hamas government, he had failed to stop at a checkpoint.

Name: Nizar Khalil Muhammad Banat
Notes: Beaten to death by Palestinian security forces after being arrested by them. Died of his wounds a short while later.

Name: Nagham Iyad 'Abd al-Fatah Salhah
Notes: Killed at home with her mother and her father, who was in a wheelchair, by a rocket fired by Palestinian militants. Another rocket hit a house further along the street, killing a woman and injuring her husband and brother-in-law.

Name: Iyad 'Abd al-Fatah Dib Salhah
Notes: Wheelchair bound. Killed at home with his wife, who was seven months pregnant, and his two-year-old daughter, by a rocket fired by Palestinian militants. Another rocket hit a house further along the street, killing a woman and injuring her husband and brother-in-law.

Name: Fidaa Fakhri Samih al-kudra
Notes: Killed at home by a rocket fired by Palestinian militants. Another rocket hit a house further along the street, killing a couple, one of whom was in a wheelchair, and their toddler daughter.

Name: Amani Yusef Muhammad Salhah
Notes: Killed at home while seven months pregnant, along with her husband, who was in a wheelchair, and her two-year-old daughter, by a rocket fired by Palestinian militants. Another rocket hit a house further along the street, killing a woman and injuring her husband and brother-in-law.

Name: Mahmoud 'Ammar Mahmoud Abu Jarad
Notes: Wounded while at his friend’s house by a rocket fired by armed Palestinians. Two other people were injured.

Name: Buthaynah Mahmoud 'Issa A'beid
Notes: A girl with intellectual disabilities. Killed on the street, near her home, by shrapnel from a rocket fired by Palestinian militants that landed there.

Name: Mahmoud Ahmad Muhammad al-Madhun
Notes: Injured when a rocket fired by Palestinian militants landed at the entrance to his house.

Name: Firyal Muhammad 'Abdallah 'Atallah
Notes: Killed on the street by a rocket fired by Palestinian militants. A minor was killed by a rocket that landed immediately afterwards. Another minor was injured and succumbed to his wounds about two days later

Name: Yihya Mazen Shihadah Khalifah
Notes: Killed by a rocket fired by Palestinian militants when he and other people gathered around a woman who had been killed by a previous rocket. Another minor was injured by the rocket and succumbed to his wounds about two days later.

Name: Mahmoud Hamed Hassan Tulbah
Notes: Injured by a rocket fired by Palestinian militants when he and other people gathered around a woman who had been killed by a previous rocket. Another minor was killed by the rocket.

Name: Hamzah Mahmoud Yasin 'Ali (Nassar)
Notes: Injured on the street, near his home, by a rocket fired by Palestinian militants. Two other people were injured.

Name: Zakaria Ziad Muhammad 'Alush
Notes: Killed along with seven other Palestinians, including two minors and a Hamas military wing operative, by a rocket that Palestinian militants fired near the al-'Omari mosque, while he was on the street. Some 30 other Palestinians were injured in the attack.

Name: Nabil Nu'man Muhammad Dardunah
Notes: Killed along with seven other Palestinians, including two minors and a Hamas military wing operative, by a rocket that Palestinian militants fired near the al-'Omari mosque, while he was on the street. Some 30 other Palestinians were injured in the attack.

Name: Musa Khamis Musa Jneid
Notes: Killed along with seven other Palestinians, including two minors and a Hamas military wing operative, by a rocket that Palestinian militants fired near the al-'Omari mosque, while he was in his family's grocery store. Some 30 other Palestinians were injured in the attack.

Name: 'Ismat Sha'ban 'Abdallah a-Zein
Notes: Killed along with seven other Palestinians, including two minors, by a rocket that Palestinian militants fired near the al-'Omari mosque, while he was on the street. Some 30 other Palestinians were injured in the attack.

Name: Raed 'Abed Zaki Abu Wardeh
Notes: Killed along with seven other Palestinians, including two minors and a Hamas military wing operative, by a rocket that Palestinian militants fired near the al-'Omari mosque, while he was on the street. Some 30 other Palestinians were injured in the attack.

Name: Bashir Muhammad Muhammad 'Alush
Notes: Killed along with seven other Palestinians, including two minors and a Hamas military wing operative, by a rocket that Palestinian militants fired near the al-'Omari mosque, while he was on the street. Some 30 other Palestinians were injured in the attack.

Name: Baraa Wisam Ahmad al-Gharabli
Notes: Killed along with seven other Palestinians, including a minor and a Hamas military wing operative, by a rocket that Palestinian militants fired near the al-'Omari mosque, while he was on the street. Some 30 other Palestinians were injured in the attack.

Name: Mustafa Muhammad Mahmoud A'beid
Notes: Killed along with seven other Palestinians, including a minor and a Hamas military wing operative, by a rocket that Palestinian militants fired near the al-'Omari mosque, while he was on the street. Some 30 other Palestinians were injured in the attack.

Name: Ibrahim Ahmad a-Shambari
Notes: Killed on a-Zeitun Street in the town by a rocket fired by Palestinian militants. Fourteen other Palestinians were injured in the attack.

Name: Muhammad Ibrahim 'Odeh a-Dabari
Notes: A detainee shot and killed by a Hamas police officer while in Hamas government custody after he fired and injured a Palestinian in a psychiatric hospital in Gaza City. The man he injured died of his wounds later that day.

Name: Muhammad Hijazi Saleh a-Laham
Notes: Killed with his brother and cousin when a test missile fired by Hamas military wing operatives struck their fishing boat.

Name: Zakaria Hijazi Saleh a-Laham
Notes: Killed with his brother and cousin when a test missile fired by Hamas military wing operatives struck their fishing boat.

Name: Yihya Mustafa Saleh a-Laham
Notes: Killed with two of his cousins when a test missile fired by Hamas military wing operatives struck their fishing boat.

Name: Munzer Rida Muhammad Hamdiyah
Notes: Wounded by Palestinian police officers’ gunfire as he fled from them during an attempt to arrest him. In video footage posted on social media, the police officers are seen dragging the injured Hamdiyah by his hands and feet, and throwing him onto the cargo bed of a pickup truck. He succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

Name: Imad a-Din Ibrahim Isma'il Dweikat
Notes: Town secretary of the Fatah movement. Fatally shot by Palestinian police officers who had come to arrest a shop owner for allegedly opening shop in violation of coronavirus restrictions, while protesting with several others against the arrest.

Name: Salah a-Din Muhammad Sa'id Zakarneh
Notes: Wounded by Palestinian police gunfire after Palestinians threw stones at them during celebrations marking the release from prison of a town resident.

Name: Muhammad 'Atiyyah Musleh Hamuda
Notes: Killed by a rocket fired by Palestinians while he was at a friend’s house. Another 25 people were injured.

Name: 'Alaa Ziad Badawi al-Gharabli
Notes: A policeman in the Hamas government police. Killed together with another policeman when an ISIS operative blew himself up at a police checkpoint. Shortly after, another ISIS operative blew himself up at another police checkpoint, killing another policeman. Nine passersby were injured in the two explosions.

Name: Salamah Majed Sa'id a-Nadim
Notes: A policeman in the Hamas government police. Killed together with another policeman when an ISIS operative blew himself up at a police checkpoint. Shortly after, another ISIS operative blew himself up at another police checkpoint, killing another policeman. Nine passersby were injured in the two explosions.

Name: Wael Musa Muhammad Khalifah
Notes: A policeman in the Hamas government police. Killed when an ISIS operative blew himself up at a police checkpoint. A short time earlier, another ISIS operative blew himself up at another police checkpoint, killing two other policemen. Nine passersby were injured in the two explosions.

Name: Hashem 'Omar 'Atallah 'Issa
Notes: Hit in the upper body by Palestinian police gunfire in Balata Refugee Camp, in a car that was fleeing a police checkpoint. Died of his wounds in a hospital in Israel.

Name: Falastin Saleh Ahmad Abu 'Arar
Notes: Killed together with her husband’s niece, a toddler, when a rocket hit the home of the Abu ‘Arar family. Three other people were injured.

Name: Siba Mahmoud Abu 'Arar
Notes: Killed together with her uncle’s wife when a rocket hit the home of the Abu ‘Arar family. Three other people were injured.

Name: Muhammad Majed Muhammad Abu Hadayed
Notes: Fatally shot by Hamas military branch operatives after the car in which he and his father were travelling did not stop at a checkpoint.

Name: Iyad 'Abd al-Fatah 'Omar Barjas
Notes: Shot in the torso by Palestinian police as he drove past a police station.

Name: Mahmoud 'Abd al-Hamid Bashir Abu 'Asbah
Notes: Killed by a wall that collapsed in an apartment building hit by a rocket Palestinians fired. He was living in the building while in Israel for work. In the same incident, two Israeli women were seriously wounded. One of them succumbed to her wounds on 17 September 2019.

Name: 'Odeh Ibrahim Hassan Jahalin
Notes: Killed by Palestinian police officers on a law enforcement mission at the gas station he worked at.

Name: Khalil Na'im Mustafa 'Atallah
Notes: Injured by shrapnel from an explosive device a Palestinian threw during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Hammad Ahmad Hammad Abu Sweireh
Notes: Member of the Hamas government internal security force. Killed in gunfire exchange with ISIS operatives during arrest of persons wanted for attempting to assassinate Palestinian Prime Minister Rami al-Hamdallah. Another member of the internal security force and two ISIS operatives were killed in the exchange.

Name: Ziad Ahmad Sarhan al-Hawajri
Notes: Member of the Hamas government internal security force. Killed in gunfire exchange with ISIS operatives during arrest of persons wanted for attempting to assassinate Palestinian Prime Minister Rami al-Hamdallah. Another member of the internal security force and two ISIS operatives were killed in the exchange.

Name: Anas 'Abd al-Malek 'Abd al-Qader Abu Khusah
Notes: ISIS operative. Killed in gunfire exchange with members of the Hamas government internal security force during arrest of persons wanted for attempting to assassinate Palestinian Prime Minister Rami al-Hamdallah. Another ISIS operative and two members of the internal security force were killed in the exchange.

Name: 'Abd al-Hadi Jum'ah Frajallah al-Ashab
Notes: ISIS operative. Killed in gunfire exchange with members of the Hamas government internal security force during arrest of persons wanted for attempting to assassinate Palestinian Prime Minister Rami al-Hamdallah. Another ISIS operative and two members of the internal security force were killed in the exchange.

Name: Ahmad Sa'id Muhammad Barhum
Notes: Shot in the chest by Hamas military branch operatives in Rafah for suspected collaboration with Israel. He was not tried.

Name: Mazen Muhammad Suliman Fuqaha
Notes: A senior Hamas military branch operative. He had been released from Israeli prison and deported to Gaza in 2011. According to Hamas, he was fatally shot by Palestinians who were later (25 May 2017) executed by the Hamas government.

Name: Hassan 'Ali Hassan Abu al-Haj
Notes: Palestinian policeman. Killed in a gun battle with armed Palestinian operatives during an arrest raid in Balata R.C.

Name: Helda Bassam Amin al-Astah
Notes: Critically injured by gunfire during clashes between armed Palestinians and members of Palestinian Authority security forces. Died of her injuries later that day. According to media reports, three members of the Palestinian Authority security forces were injured in the clashes.

Name: Ahmad 'Izat Ahmad Halawah
Notes: Beaten to death in Juneid Prison in Nablus by members of the Palestinian security forces, after being arrested on suspicion of planning to kill two Palestinian policemen a week earlier.

Name: 'Adel Naser Fares Jaradat
Notes: Shot and killed by Palestinian police during clashes that included the throwing of stones and explosives. The clashes had erupted after an operation to arrest a criminal.

Name: Shadi Zuhdi Rateb 'Arafah
Notes: Shot dead by a Palestinian civilian who opened fire at Israeli vehicles. An Israeli civilian and a foreign national were also killed by the gunfire. The shooter was shot and injured by security forces and taken into custody.

Name: Ahmad Hazem Muhammad Shbeir
Notes: Killed with nine children and an adult while the children were playing on playground equipment in the street. Another boy who was injured in the incident later died of his injuries.

Name: Yusef 'Abd a-Rahman A'bbas Hasunah
Notes: Killed with nine children and an adult while the children were playing on playground equipment in the street. Another boy who was injured in the incident later died of his injuries.

Name: Baraa Akram Muhammad Miqdad
Notes: Killed with nine children and an adult while the children were playing on playground equipment in the street. Another boy who was injured in the incident later died of his injuries.

Name: Mansur Rami Mansur Hajjaj
Notes: Killed with nine children and an adult while the children were playing on playground equipment in the street. Another boy who was injured in the incident later died of his injuries.

Name: Mahmoud Riyad Hazem Shbeir
Notes: Killed with nine children and an adult while the children were playing on playground equipment in the street. Another boy who was injured in the incident later died of his injuries.

Name: Ousamah Ahmad 'Abd a-Razeq al-Hilu
Notes: Injured while playing on playground equipment in the street when he came to visit relatives in the neighborhood. Ten other children and an adult were also killed in this incident.

Name: Muhammad 'Imad Muhammad Barud
